sources.name: Lab-grown beef prices- NextBigFuture
sources.description:
Data published by Next Big Future (2017). "Lab grown meat prices have dropped 30,000 times in less than four years and are about 3-4 times more expensive than regular ground beef"
Link https://www.nextbigfuture.com/2017/02/lab-grown-meat-prices-have-dropped.html
Retrieved 2017-07-11

Data is based on industry and company reports from lab-scale (not commercial-scale) production of in-vitro beef.

Prices have been reported in US$ per pound (lb) of lab-grown beef. We have converted this to US$ per kilogram using a conversion factor of 0.454.

sources.name: Retail Beef Prices- US Bureau of Labor Statistics
sources.description:
Data published by United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS)
Link https://data.bls.gov/timeseries/APU0000703112
Retrieved 2017-07-11

Data taken as the US national average retail prices of 100% ground beef. Monthly averages have been converted to an annual average.

Prices by BLS are reported in US$ per pound (lb) of beef. We have converted this to US$ per kilogram using a conversion factor of 0.454.
